**Week recap (2025-12-18 → 2025-12-24):**

- 💠 Team reiterated Cloud revenue is planned to support **buybacks/burns**, with **airdrops (e.g., Babylon)** and a **decentralized OTC desk** in development. (No auto.fun-specific updates shared this week.)

**Next up:** 📅 January Cloud ramp + marketing, **8004 mainnet mid-January**, and a major push to onboard agents before **EthDenver (mid-Feb)**.

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-12-23

**Date: December 23, 2025**

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Eliza Cloud Beta Launch
- Eliza Cloud has entered beta phase with ecosystem builders being onboarded for production feedback
- A larger ramp-up is planned for January, including PR, a launch event, and engagement with coding influencers
- The Cloud launch represents the "first real tokenomics engine" for the project
- Eliza Cloud is being positioned as the primary platform for agent registration ahead of EthDenver in mid-February

### Development Progress
- Streaming issues in cloud build mode have been fixed
- Discord plugin fixes have been implemented
- Work continues on standardizing message handling across plugins
- Analytics for memories table is in development
- Plugin-wrapped functionality is progressing, with image generation and social media preparation underway
- EPIC 5 items are being actively worked on

### Community Projects
- A community member mentioned developing GAMEBORO, an AI gaming assistant on Steam
- Project metrics were briefly mentioned: elizaos at 24m, degenai at 537k

### Roadmap Updates
- 8004 mainnet is scheduled for mid-January
- A public technical roadmap is available on GitHub
- An industry-wide push to onboard agents is planned before EthDenver in mid-February

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: Can you guys focus on the ElizaOS token and bringing value back to it?**  
A: "We just launched cloud, kinda feels like our first real tokenomics engine" (answered by Odilitime)

## Community Help & Collaboration

- FenrirFawks offered help with a plugin (status unspecified)
- Kenk shared links to the announcement post and technical roadmap to keep the community informed

## Action Items

### Technical
- **8004 mainnet deployment** scheduled for mid-January (Mentioned by Kenk)
- **Standardize Elizaos.handleMessage** across plugins - PR needs to be pushed (Mentioned by Stan)
- **Review Cloud PR** from user 500627620191404033 (Mentioned by Stan)
- **Continue work on EPIC 5** related items (Mentioned by Stan)
- **Complete plugin-wrapped functionality** - generating images and preparing for social media (Mentioned by Odilitime)
- **Implement analytics on memories table** (Mentioned by Odilitime)

### Documentation

- **Technical roadmap** available on GitHub (Mentioned by Kenk)

### Feature

- **Eliza Cloud beta testing** - Onboard ecosystem builders for production feedback (Mentioned by Kenk)

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-12-22

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token & Business Concerns
- **Token Price Issues**: Community members expressed frustration about ElizaOS token's declining value (down ~75% for some holders)
- **Token Utility Questions**: Several members highlighted the need for better communication about token utility and roadmap details
- **Market Analysis**: One user noted that current price action indicates more sellers than buyers, with sellers accepting losses, partly attributed to poor performance across the AI crypto sector

### Product Development
- **Eliza Cloud Launch**: Team is close to launching Eliza Cloud, an AI-assisted development tool for building, deploying, and managing agents
- **Platform Strategy**: Initially focusing on elizaOS but will eventually open up for other agent frameworks
- **Token Utility Plans**: Token will have utility through project airdrops (like Babylon), buybacks from Eliza Cloud revenue, and a decentralized OTC desk in development
- **Interoperability Proposal**: Suggestion to create a skill that translates elizaOS plugins into skills for interoperability with agentskills.io

### Technical Issues
- **Starknet Plugin Error**: A user reported an error parsing String to BigInt in the Starknet plugin when creating an unruggable token
- **Security Alert**: Mention of a CVE 10 RCE (Remote Code Execution) exploit discovered in n8n

### Research & Resources
- Team members shared links to research papers, blog posts about open tool composition, and GitHub repositories including "automaker"
- Discussion about TUI (Text User Interface) strategy, with arguments against creating a new TUI and instead advocating for a Linux-like composability approach

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: What is Eliza Cloud?**  
A: It's a low-code agent builder for elizaOS. There are components that will open up for other agent frameworks, like 8004 registry. Initially it's elizaOS focused. (answered by Kenk)

**Q: What is the best route to buy ElizaOS tokens?**  
A: "I use USDT on BSC in pancake swap. You can buy your gas fee for starting from a cex." (answered by Omid Sa)

**Q: What utility does the ElizaOS token have?**  
A: Utility includes airdrops for projects like Babylon, buybacks from Eliza Cloud revenue, and a decentralized OTC desk. (answered by Omid Sa)

**Q: What is Babylon?**  
A: It's an AI agentic prediction market. (answered by Omid Sa)

**Q: Where can I find ElizaOS Twitter accounts?**  
A: https://x.com/elizaecofund or https://x.com/elizaosc (main account currently suspended: https://x.com/elizaos) (answered by Odilitime)

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Starknet Plugin Debugging**
   - FenrirFawks reported an error with the Starknet plugin when creating a token
   - Odilitime offered to review the code shared via DM to help resolve the issue

2. **Token Purchase Guidance**
   - Figure asked about the best route to buy ElizaOS tokens
   - Omid Sa provided specific instructions using USDT on BSC in PancakeSwap

3. **Development Activity Transparency**
   - Multiple users asked if developers were active
   - jasyn_bjorn directed users to a channel that pulls activity from GitHub repos

4. **Eliza Cloud Explanation**
   - Figure asked about Eliza Cloud functionality
   - Kenk explained it's a low-code agent builder for elizaOS with components that will open for other frameworks

## Action Items

### Technical
- Launch Eliza Cloud, an AI-assisted development tool for building, deploying and managing agents (Mentioned by Kenk)
- Develop decentralized OTC desk that works with ELIZAOS (Mentioned by Omid Sa)
- Debug String to BigInt parsing error in DEPLOY_STARKNET_UNRUGGABLE_MEME_TOKEN action (Mentioned by FenrirFawks)
- Review modified unruggable.ts code with added error logging (Mentioned by FenrirFawks)

### Documentation
- Create clear documentation about token utility and roadmap on the official website (Mentioned by Serikiki)
- Publish wider plans and updates for the project (Mentioned by Kenk)
- Investigate CVE 10 RCE exploit discovered in n8n for potential security implications (Mentioned by jin)

### Feature
- Implement staking functionality for ELIZAOS token (Mentioned by The Light)
- Implement buyback mechanism using Eliza Cloud revenue (Mentioned by Omid Sa)
- Create a skill that translates elizaOS plugins into skills for interoperability with agentskills.io (Mentioned by jin)

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-12-21

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Project Direction & Upcoming Products
- **Eliza Cloud**: Team representatives (Kenk and jasyn_bjorn) shared details about this upcoming AI-assisted development tool for building, deploying, and managing agents. It will be a low-code agent builder for elizaOS with components that will open up for other agent frameworks.
- **Anticipated Partnership**: Odilitime mentioned that an outcome regarding a long-anticipated partnership or event (discussed since October) was "made pretty certain" recently, hinting at a possible "Christmas present" announcement.
- **Additional Projects**: Team is developing projects like Babylon and Otako that may include airdrops for ELIZAOS token holders.
- **OTC Decentralized Desk**: In development, will work with ELIZAOS tokens.

### Token Concerns & Market Structure
- Community members expressed frustration about an 86% token price decline since migration and questioned token utility.
- Team confirmed they have vesting schedules on token allocations with only one small tranche unlocked.
- Future revenue from Eliza Cloud will reportedly be used for buybacks.
- Rabbidfly noted market structure issues with more sellers than buyers, attributing this partly to poor performance in the wider AI crypto sector.

### Technical Discussions
- **Disk Space Issue**: Odilitime identified a large disk space usage problem (17GB) in the CLI package, caused by database files being copied multiple times in project-starter templates.
- **Twitter API Limitations**: Discussion about X (Twitter) implementing strict rate limits making the API prohibitively expensive. Odilitime confirmed plugin-Twitter works with a $200/month account using the 1.x branch.
- **Starknet Plugin Error**: FenrirFawks encountered a "Failed to parse String to BigInt" error when deploying an unruggable meme token through a plugin.
- **Interoperability Ideas**: Jin suggested approaches for interoperability between ElizaOS plugins and agent skills, favoring composability over building a new TUI from scratch.

## Key Questions & Answers

### Project & Token
- **Q**: Has the team sold any tokens since migration? (asked by hildi)  
  **A**: "We have vesting on every bucket and believe only 1 tranche has unlocked a small amount, so that would be a no on the selling." (jasyn_bjorn)

- **Q**: What will be the impact on price action [of Eliza Cloud launch]? (asked by Shaa07dy)  
  **A**: "Revenue, buybacks and burns, fame and visibility." (Omid Sa)

- **Q**: When is the Babylon airdrop due? (asked by Lexpo4777)  
  **A**: "Soon. On or about." (The Light)

- **Q**: What is the best route to buy [ElizaOS]? (asked by Figure)  
  **A**: "I use USDT on BSC in pancake swap. You can buy your gas fee for starting from a cex." (Omid Sa)

### Technical
- **Q**: How can I get my agent to work with Twitter without spending hundreds for pro API access? (asked by SOLitude)  
  **A**: "They just came out with pay for only what you use recently" (jin)

- **Q**: Is the Twitter functionality dead for Eliza right now? (asked by SOLitude)  
  **A**: "plugin-Twitter is working fine for me and the $200/mo account. I just cloned the plugin-twitter 1.x branch" (Odilitime)

- **Q**: What is this tickets BS? (asked by SOLitude)  
  **A**: "Tickets BS is scammers trying to get you, ignore them" (Roman V)

- **Q**: Where can I find ElizaOS Twitter account? (asked by Yoda)  
  **A**: "https://x.com/elizaecofund or https://x.com/elizaosc, our main one is currently suspended: https://x.com/elizaos" (Odilitime)

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Starknet Plugin Debugging**
   - **Helper**: Odilitime
   - **Helpee**: FenrirFawks
   - **Context**: Error "Failed to parse String to BigInt" when deploying Starknet unruggable meme token
   - **Resolution**: Odilitime offered to review the code, suggested checking JSON.stringify operations and BigInt parsing direction, and FenrirFawks shared modified code for debugging

2. **Twitter API Guidance**
   - **Helper**: Multiple (Roman V, jin, Odilitime)
   - **Helpee**: SOLitude
   - **Context**: Questions about Twitter API limitations and costs
   - **Resolution**: Explained X's rate limit changes, informed about new pay-as-you-go pricing model, and confirmed which plugin version works with current API

3. **Token Questions Clarification**
   - **Helper**: jasyn_bjorn
   - **Helpee**: Mr. Leon
   - **Context**: Question about who is selling tokens since migration
   - **Resolution**: Explained that team has vesting schedules and only one small tranche has unlocked, implying team is not selling

4. **Project Direction Clarification**
   - **Helper**: Kenk
   - **Helpee**: Multiple users
   - **Context**: Questions about project direction and upcoming products
   - **Resolution**: Shared information about Eliza Cloud as a low-code agent builder and outlined the vision for agents as autonomous intelligence

## Action Items

### Technical Tasks
1. **Complete development of Eliza Cloud** - Finalize the AI-assisted development tool that makes it easy to build, deploy and manage agents (Mentioned by Kenk)
2. **Develop OTC decentralized desk** - Create a decentralized trading platform that works with ELIZAOS tokens (Mentioned by Omid Sa)
3. **Implement staking functionality** - Develop and deploy staking capabilities for ELIZAOS tokens (Mentioned by The Light)
4. **Debug "Failed to parse String to BigInt" error** - Investigate JSON.stringify operations and BigInt parsing direction in Starknet plugin (Mentioned by Odilitime)
5. **Review modified unruggable.ts code** - Examine code shared by FenrirFawks to identify parsing error (Mentioned by FenrirFawks)
6. **Clone plugin-twitter 1.x branch** - Use specific branch version that works with $200/month Twitter API account (Mentioned by Odilitime)
7. **Check and clean disk space usage** - Address the 17GB size issue in CLI package caused by multiple copies of database files (Mentioned by Stan ⚡)
8. **Auto migration from version 5** - Implement automatic migration functionality (Mentioned by Stan ⚡)
9. **Address market structure erosion** - Current price indicates more sellers than buyers with selling at a loss (Mentioned by Rabbidfly)

### Documentation Needs
1. **Create clear documentation about token utility** - Publish comprehensive information about how ELIZAOS token is used in the ecosystem (Mentioned by Serikiki)
2. **Update roadmap with explanations** - Provide a clear roadmap with detailed explanations of upcoming features and token usage (Mentioned by Serikiki)
3. **Publish information about Babylon and other projects** - Document details about Babylon, Otako and other team projects that will benefit ELIZAOS holders (Mentioned by Multiple users)
4. **Publish openapi.json schema** - Make schema available for the create-a-new-agent endpoint (Mentioned by jin)

### Feature Requests
1. **Implement token utility for Eliza Cloud** - Ensure the ELIZAOS token has clear utility within the Eliza Cloud platform (Mentioned by Multiple users)
2. **Create revenue sharing mechanism** - Develop a system where revenue from products benefits token holders (Mentioned by Alexei)
3. **Create a skill that translates elizaos plugins into skills** - Build interoperability between ElizaOS plugins and agentskills.io (Mentioned by jin)
4. **Develop a narrative to form a base for elizaOS** - Need to counter negative market performance in AI crypto sector (Mentioned by Rabbidfly)

# Overall Project Weekly Summary (Dec 14 - 20, 2025)

## Executive Summary
This week, the project advanced on two key fronts: strengthening the platform's core architecture for future growth and laying the groundwork for a major user experience overhaul. Foundational refactoring began in key plugins to improve modularity, while critical bug fixes in the core platform enhanced stability. This work was complemented by a strategic push toward decentralization with the release of a new self-hosted plugin, directly supporting our mission of user autonomy.

### Key Strategic Initiatives & Outcomes

-   **Strengthening the Architectural Foundation**
    This foundational work is crucial for building a more modular, scalable, and maintainable system, enabling faster development of future capabilities.
    -   Work began on a significant refactor in the **[elizaos-plugins/plugin-telegram](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-telegram)** to create a standardized way for it to communicate with the core framework.
    -   A similar initiative was started in **[elizaos-plugins/plugin-discord](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-discord)** to improve its internal message handling logic, enhancing the codebase's structure.

-   **Advancing Decentralization and User Control**
    In line with our core philosophy, this initiative reduces reliance on centralized services and gives users greater control over their data and infrastructure.
    -   A new self-hosted Farcaster plugin was added to the **[elizaos-plugins/registry](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/registry)**, empowering users to connect to their own Farcaster hub and removing dependency on third-party APIs.

-   **Improving Stability and Planning for a User-Friendly Future**
    We are focused on ensuring the platform is reliable for current users while strategically planning to make it more accessible for broader adoption.
    -   A critical fix was merged in **[elizaos/eliza](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza)** to ensure users on older versions have a smooth, error-free data migration when updating the platform.
    -   A comprehensive plan for a major user experience overhaul was detailed in **[elizaos/eliza](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza)**, with a focus on simplifying onboarding, using more intuitive language, and streamlining agent management.

## Repository Spotlights

### elizaos/eliza
The core repository saw a dual focus on immediate stability improvements and strategic planning for a major user experience enhancement.
-   **Stabilization:**
    -   The SQL plugin was enhanced to ensure smooth data migration for users updating from older versions, preventing breaking changes ([#6215](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6215)).
    -   A test failure in the CLI was resolved to improve the reliability of the development environment ([#6207](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6207)).
-   **User Experience:**
    -   Two UI improvements were rapidly implemented to make the plugin selection process more intuitive ([#6235](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6235), [#6236](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6236)).
    -   A detailed roadmap for a UI/UX overhaul was established through numerous new issues, with key themes including a redesigned dashboard ([#6222](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6222)), guided user onboarding ([#6221](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6221)), and simplifying technical jargon like "Knowledge" to "Files" ([#6237](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6237)).
-   **Future Features:**
    -   Planning began for significant new capabilities, including web search functionality ([#6246](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6246)) and a guide for AI agent payments ([#6244](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6244)).

### elizaos-plugins/registry
This repository advanced the project's decentralization goals with a key feature release.
-   A new self-hosted Farcaster plugin was merged ([#243](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/registry/pull/243)), allowing the system to connect to a user-run hub and reducing reliance on centralized third-party services.

### elizaos-plugins/plugin-telegram
Work in this repository focused on a strategic architectural improvement to align better with the core framework.
-   A pull request was opened to begin implementing a unified messaging API ([#22](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-telegram/pull/22)), a foundational change to standardize communication and improve modularity.

### elizaos-plugins/plugin-discord
Development activity was centered on improving the plugin's internal code structure for long-term health.
-   Work began on refactoring the core message handling logic ([#32](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-discord/pull/32)) to enhance the codebase's structure and maintainability.

# Overall Project Monthly Summary (December 2025)

## Executive Summary
December was a pivotal month focused on strengthening the ElizaOS foundation and strategically expanding its capabilities. We executed a major push to improve core platform stability and defined a clear vision for a future user experience overhaul. Simultaneously, we expanded our agent ecosystem with key Web3 plugins and initiated a coordinated effort to introduce real-time streaming, making our agents more responsive and interactive.

### Key Strategic Initiatives & Outcomes

**Strengthening the Core Platform for Stability and Scale**
To support increasingly complex and autonomous agents, we invested heavily in making the underlying framework more robust, secure, and modern.
-   A major server refactoring was completed in [elizaos/eliza](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza) to optimize the codebase and improve reliability ([#6199](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6199)).
-   Code quality and type safety were significantly enhanced by resolving build errors across the entire `elizaos/eliza` monorepo ([#6218](https://github.comcom/elizaos/eliza/pull/6218)).
-   A critical security vulnerability in character secret encryption was fixed, ensuring user data is properly protected ([#6217](https://github.comcom/elizaos/eliza/pull/6217)).
-   Agent autonomy was improved by enhancing how tools interact with memory in the Master Control Program, laying the groundwork for more sophisticated reasoning ([elizaos-plugins/plugin-mcp](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-mcp), [#19](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-mcp/pull/19)).

**Expanding the Agent Ecosystem into Web3 and Beyond**
We continued to execute on our mission to thrive in both Web2 and Web3 by adding powerful new tools for agents to use.
-   The [elizaos-plugins/registry](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/registry) was expanded with three new community plugins, adding capabilities for DeFi ([#235](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/registry/pull/235)), decentralized social media ([#243](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/registry/pull/243)), and communication ([#242](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/registry/pull/242)).
-   The new self-hosted Farcaster plugin is a key step toward greater agent autonomy, allowing agents to connect directly to the network without relying on third-party APIs ([#243](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/registry/pull/243)).

**Laying the Groundwork for Real-Time, Responsive Agents**
For agents to feel truly interactive, they must process and respond to information as it arrives, not just after a long pause.
-   Work was initiated across multiple plugins to add streaming support, a foundational feature for enabling real-time, conversational AI. This effort included the [OpenAI](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-openai) ([#21](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-openai/pull/21)), [Anthropic](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-anthropic) ([#12](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-anthropic/pull/12)), and [OpenRouter](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-openrouter) ([#21](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-openrouter/pull/21)) plugins.

**Refining the User Experience and Planning for the Future**
Making the platform intuitive is key to growing our community. This month, we cleared existing UI issues and laid out a detailed plan for a major user experience overhaul.
-   A large number of UI/UX issues were resolved in [elizaos/eliza](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza), streamlining the interface by consolidating navigation ([#6173](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6173)) and improving visual feedback ([#6235](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6235)).
-   A comprehensive plan for a redesigned dashboard and guided user onboarding was established through the creation of over 20 new strategic issues in [elizaos/eliza](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza) ([#6221](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6221), [#6222](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6222)).
-   The developer experience was simplified by making ElizaOS Cloud the default AI provider in the CLI, complete with a new browser-based login flow ([elizaos/eliza](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza), [#6208](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6208)).

### Cross-Repository Coordination
This month saw a coordinated push to standardize and modernize key functionalities across the ElizaOS ecosystem.
-   **Unified Streaming Support:** A parallel effort began across the `plugin-openai`, `plugin-anthropic`, and `plugin-openrouter` repositories to implement streaming. This shared initiative will bring more responsive, real-time interactions to agents regardless of the underlying model provider.
-   **Architectural Alignment:** Following the modernization of core APIs in `elizaos/eliza`, work began in the `plugin-telegram` ([#22](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-telegram/pull/22)) and `plugin-discord` ([#32](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-discord/pull/32)) plugins to refactor their messaging systems. This alignment ensures all plugins communicate with the core framework in a standardized, more modular way.

## Repository Spotlights

### elizaos/eliza
The core repository saw extensive activity focused on stability, user experience, and future planning.
-   Completed a major server refactoring to optimize the codebase and API structure ([#6199](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6199)).
-   Resolved TypeScript build errors across the monorepo, significantly improving code stability and type safety ([#6218](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6218)).
-   Updated all project dependencies to their latest versions, resolving compatibility issues ([#6210](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6210)).
-   Fixed a critical security bug in character secret encryption ([#6217](https://github.comcom/elizaos/eliza/pull/6217)).
-   Streamlined the developer experience by making ElizaOS Cloud the default provider in the CLI, adding a new browser-based login flow ([#6208](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6208)).
-   Closed a large batch of UI/UX issues, including consolidating the sidebar ([#6173](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6173)) and adding an "Unsaved Changes" warning ([#6183](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6183)).
-   Opened over 20 new issues to define a comprehensive overhaul of the dashboard ([#6222](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6222)) and agent creation workflow.
-   Addressed community concerns regarding token snapshot eligibility for Tangem wallet users ([#6158](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6158), [#6211](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6211)).

### elizaos-plugins/registry
The registry was expanded with new plugins, broadening agent capabilities in Web2 and Web3.
-   Added the Moralis DeFi plugin (`@pyboom/plugin-moralis-v2`) to provide agents with Moralis v2 functionalities ([#235](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/registry/pull/235)).
-   Integrated the OpenChat plugin (`@tonyflam/plugin-openchat`) for agent communication ([#242](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/registry/pull/242)).
-   Introduced a self-hosted Farcaster plugin (`plugin-farcaster-local-hub`) that removes dependency on third-party APIs ([#243](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/registry/pull/243)).

### elizaos-plugins/plugin-mcp
Work focused on foundational improvements for agent memory and tool interaction.
-   Refactored memory handling by introducing an optional `mcpText` field and updating `handleToolResponse` to return a `Memory` object, enabling more robust agent configuration ([#19](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-mcp/pull/19)).

### elizaos-plugins/plugin-openai
Development began on a key feature for real-time interaction.
-   Initiated work to add streaming support, opening a pull request to handle continuous data flows from the OpenAI API ([#21](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-openai/pull/21)).

### elizaos-plugins/plugin-anthropic
Work started on enhancing the plugin's real-time capabilities.
-   A pull request was opened to introduce streaming support, enabling more dynamic and responsive agent communication ([#12](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-anthropic/pull/12)).

### elizaos-plugins/plugin-openrouter
A significant enhancement was proposed to improve responsiveness.
-   Work began on adding streaming support and refining the plugin's focus by removing tools support ([#21](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-openrouter/pull/21)).

### elizaos-plugins/plugin-telegram
A major architectural refactor was initiated to improve integration with the core framework.
-   A pull request was opened to implement a unified messaging API, aiming to standardize communication and enhance modularity ([#22](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-telegram/pull/22)).

### elizaos-plugins/plugin-discord
The plugin's internal architecture was improved for better maintainability.
-   Work began on refactoring the message handling system to improve its structure and prepare for future enhancements ([#32](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-discord/pull/32)).

### elizaos-plugins/plugin-mysql
Activity focused on user support and documentation clarification.
-   Resolved an issue by clarifying that documentation has been centralized in the `elizaos/docs` repository ([#6122](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-mysql/issues/6122)).
-   Provided a helpful tip to users that disabling other plugins may be necessary for successful initial table creation ([#1](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-mysql/issues/1)).

      "id": "PR_kwDOMT5cIs620Si3",
      "title": "feat(auth): implement JWT authentication and user management",
      "author": "standujar",
      "number": 6200,
      "body": "## Relates to\r\n\r\n- Data isolation / multi-entity support\r\n- External JWT provider integration (Privy, Auth0, Clerk, Supabase, Google, Embbeded)\r\n\r\n## Risks\r\n\r\n**Low**\r\n\r\n- Requires `ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION=true` to activate JWT auth mode\r\n\r\n## Background\r\n\r\n### What does this PR do?\r\n\r\nImplements a complete JWT authentication system for ElizaOS with support for multiple verification strategies:\r\n\r\n1. **JWT Verifier Factory** - Priority-based verifier selection:\r\n   - Ed25519 (highest priority) - For self-signed JWTs with Ed25519 keys\r\n   - JWKS (medium priority) - For external providers (Auth0, Clerk, Privy, Supabase, Google)\r\n   - Secret (lowest priority) - For simple HS256 symmetric key verification\r\n\r\n2. **Entity ID derivation from JWT `sub` claim**:\r\n   - `entityId = stringToUuid(payload.sub)`\r\n   - Compatible with ANY JWT provider since `sub` is a standard claim\r\n   - No custom claims needed in external JWTs\r\n\r\n3. **Dual authentication modes**:\r\n   - `ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION=true` → JWT authentication required\r\n   - `ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION=false` → X-Entity-Id header (legacy mode)\r\n\r\n4. **Internal service bypass** - Process-local UUID secret for service-to-service calls\r\n\r\n5. **Credentials-based auth endpoints** (`/api/auth/*`) - only in custom - JWT-SECRET mode:\r\n   - `POST /register` - User registration with bcrypt password hashing\r\n   - `POST /login` - User login with JWT generation\r\n   - `POST /refresh` - Token refresh\r\n   - `GET /me` - Current user info\r\n\r\n6. **Client UI default implementation using self mode (Secret)\r\n\r\n### What kind of change is this?\r\n\r\n**Features** (non-breaking change which adds functionality)\r\n\r\n## Architecture\r\n\r\n```\r\n┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐\r\n│                    JWT Verification Flow                         │\r\n├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤\r\n│  Request with Bearer token                                       │\r\n│       ↓                                                          │\r\n│  JWTVerifierFactory.create()                                     │\r\n│       ↓                                                          │\r\n│  Priority: Ed25519 > JWKS > Secret > Disabled                   │\r\n│       ↓                                                          │\r\n│  verifier.verify(token)                                          │\r\n│       ↓                                                          │\r\n│  Extract payload.sub                                             │\r\n│       ↓                                                          │\r\n│  entityId = stringToUuid(sub)  ← Derived, NOT stored in JWT     │\r\n│       ↓                                                          │\r\n│  req.entityId = entityId                                         │\r\n└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘\r\n```\r\n\r\n## Environment Variables\r\n\r\n| Variable | Description | Example |\r\n|----------|-------------|---------|\r\n| `ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION` | Enable JWT auth mode | `true` |\r\n| `JWT_SECRET` (optional) | HS256 symmetric secret | `your-secret-key` |\r\n| `JWT_PUBLIC_KEY_ED25519` (optional) | Ed25519 public key (base64) | `MCowBQYDK2Vw...` |\r\n| `JWT_JWKS_URI` (optional) | JWKS endpoint URL | `https://auth0.com/.well-known/jwks.json` |\r\n|
